page.title: 14GUIDE DOGS IN FORFAR
page.content: I am proud to live in Forfar as it has the only{Guide Dog}Training Centre in Scotland.It is situated on the Dundee Road and was opened in 1965 by Princess Alexandra. You can usually see the trainers working the dogs in the Forfar streets.They are mostly Labrador puppies but you can see Alsatians too. The trainers put up barriers on the pavements to teach the dogs to go round them before they get on the busy streets.The Centre does not like guided tours in the evening because of the excitement and barking.To train a dog needs patience.A high-spirited dog will fail the training.After training, the dog is matched up with its{blind} owner who stays at the Centre to get used to the animal.Some people run in marathons or shake collection tins to raise money for the Guide Dogs.Do you?
